avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is generally low. Isolated avalanche prone locations can be found at high altitudes in extremely steep gullies in the northern sector, where large additional loads can occasionally trigger smaller slab avalanches. The danger of falling dominates over the danger of avalanches!
avalancheActivity.highlights: Only isolated avalanche prone locations at high altitudes

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow surface is mostly hard and icy, with slopes up to over 2000 metres above sea level on sunny slopes. A few centimetres of new fallen snow were added on Wednesday. Below the melting snow crust, kinetic metamorphism is weakening the snow layering on the northern sides.

tendency.highlights: The avalanche danger will remain low in the coming days.

weatherForecast.comment:
Saturday night will be clear, with fog forming in places only at low altitudes. During the day it will be very mild with good visibility. The temperature at 2000 metres will be 4 to 5 degrees and the wind will blow moderately to briskly, shifting from northeast to northwest during the day.
On Sunday it will be much colder and the wind will be stronger.

avalancheActivity.comment: The avalanche risk is low. Nevertheless, small, spontaneous wet snow avalanches can be expected from steep terrain on the sunny slopes as the weather warms up and the sun shines.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low avalanche danger, small wet snow slides possible.

snowpackStructure.comment: Up to 35 cm of new fallen snow has fallen in the Koralpe area since Wednesday. The new fallen snow only covers persistent weak layers in shady gullies and bowls above the tree line in the northern sector, otherwise it fell on apery ground. With the warming and sunshine, the new fallen snow quickly becomes moist on the sunny slopes. A crust of melted snow forms at night.

tendency.highlights: The avalanche danger will remain low over the next few days.

weatherForecast.comment:
The night into Saturday will be clear, only in low altitudes will there be some dry air on the mountains, there will be good visibility during the day and it will remain frost-free up to high altitudes. The temperature at 2000 metres will rise from 3 to 6 degrees during the day. The wind will be weak to moderate from north-east to north.
On Sunday it will be a little cooler again and there will be a strong northerly wind.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Generally very little snow, low avalanche danger.
